content.description: Stand start on a good "old" V3(?) pocket problem on the right side of the face and do the first couple "hard" moves up the V3 then instead of topping it out traverse left all the way to the moss before the tree and then pull onto the slab to finish - classic slopers and pockets!

This can be a tight chimney climb depending on your attack strategy. We had some success facing towards

and

away from the center rock with climbers of various sizes. You can either finish around the front or continue in and out the top.

Called "The Helmet Clamp" because of its squeeze-y nature. Wear a helmet!
content.protection: Set TR anchor at the top of the center rock. You can access anchor from rear by following trail to the right (West) around and up. Be sure to properly equalize, since your climber will be pulling slightly rightwards towards the chimney.

content.description: This is a fun chimney climb with its crux at the exit towards anchor. We've had fun with several unique solutions to this exit! See what you come up with.
content.protection: Set TR anchor at the top of the center rock. You can access anchor from rear by following trail to the right (West) around and up. Be sure to properly equalize, since your climber will be pulling slightly left towards the chimney.

content.description:
This route will constantly annoy you with bizarre, basackwards moves and other things that hadn't occurred to further your climbing move arsenal since you were five. However, you might want to remember some of the resulting moves. This is the right bolted route on the Lower Muffins. It moves up the left side of the lowest rightside rock up to a bolted section of balance switching moves.

If you're going to lead this route, you should either stick clip the first bolt or keep a crashpad handy as the bolt is over a tough first move 10' off the ground. This move found me running off the climb on lead and getting caught by my belayer as I was running downhill 10 feet later. Avoid the temptation to start from the right, as it will probably lead you nowhere.
content.protection: Three bolts to a 2 bolt top anchor. A crashpad or a stick clip will be useful up to the first bolt.

content.description:
This is the leftmost bolted route on the Lower Muffin. To reach this climb from the main path, simply walk to The Muffins, and it will be the leftmost climb of the three bolted routes on the Lower Muffin.

This route involves a 5.10 "power" move, as the route has solid grips all the way up, it's just a matter of pulling your body along the way.

The top is a little mossy, but the important grips were (when we climbed it) uncovered.
content.protection: 2 draws to a 2 bolt top anchor. Access to set up a toprope is accomplished by walking around the right side of the Lower Muffin to the backside, and then climbing a short distance to the anchors on top.

content.description: Located on the center rock of the three Lower Muffins, Burnt Muffin involves a big reach to the left.  Shorter people will have to be much more resourceful than their taller counterparts - as wingspan becomes a important issue.
content.protection: 2 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor, the first bolt protects the crux very well, so it would be rather difficult to cause yourself any harm.
